text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm live or chata that's right every
year I like to do at least one drink
video and this amazingly refreshing
drink is going to be 2017 s offering and
by the way just in case you're from
Spain we're going to be doing the next
conversion which is rice and almond
based versus the Spanish version which
apparently uses Tiger nuts
which to me sounds really dangerous but
anyway we'll be doing the version that
uses rice and to all the people that
request vegan recipes discounts so with
that let's go ahead and get started the
first up we're going to need some rice
but nothing fancy just 1 cup of regular
long grain rice which we'll toss into
our blender and then to that we're going
to add some whole raw almonds and by the
way a lot of recipes call for blanching
these first and peeling them but I'm
going to skip that step I think they're
fine like this
we will also toss in one cinnamon stick
as well as a little touch of sugar and
then last but not least we will pour in
some nice cold fresh water but not all
of it we're only going to add about half
otherwise it's going to file over when
we try to blend it so what we'll do is
blend this with half and then add the
rest later
and then there's basically two ways you
can do this you can let this sit and
then blend it or you can blend it and
let it sit which is the way I'm doing it
today and I'll call this version the
quick method since if you do this in the
morning you can drink in the afternoon
ok the other way you generally need to
leave it overnight and I'm going to talk
about that in detail on the blog post
but for now we'll just go ahead and
blend it pulsing on and off to start and
then I'll let that blend on high for
about 30 seconds or so until we're
pretty sure that stuff is chopped up
into pretty small pieces
in case you're wondering yes we are
going to strain all this later so don't
feel like you have to get this perfectly
smooth and then what we'll do once
that's blended up is go ahead and add
the rest of our cold fresh water and
then once that's been dumped in we don't
have anything else to do except wait in
the longer the better
okay ideally you pop this in the fridge
overnight and then strain it the next
day but for the quick version what we'll
do is just let this sit out at room
temperature for at least four hours
possibly giving it a stir once in a
while and believe it or not that is
pretty much how you make the easy
version of or chata after four hours on
the countertop or like I said overnight
in the fridge all we have left to do
before we can drink this is strain it
which I would generally do through three
or four thicknesses of cheesecloth but
this time I want to test out a new
product I got which is called a nut milk
bag no I'm not kidding this really is
called a nut milk bag or if you prefer
something that sounds even more
inappropriate it's also referred to as a
nut milk sack and what I'll do is place
that in this pitcher and then we'll go
ahead and pour in our mixture and while
I will admit this was really easy to use
and is washable and reusable it didn't
quite strain out as much sediment it's
three or four layers of cheesecloth
would have and as I said I'll go into a
little more detail on the block but the
point is you do need to strain this
otherwise it's going to be way too
gritty to enjoy when you drink it and by
the way if you notice the viscosity we
have something that's pretty thin okay
some versions are much thicker which
isn't necessarily a bad thing it's just
not what I'm going for here okay what I
want here is what they call it a
taqueria an agua fresca okay so I want
something very light and refreshing but
anyway we'll go ahead and strain that
and that's it our chata is done and at
this point once it's strained I normally
would pop that picture in the fridge to
chill it thoroughly but I'm just going
to pretend because the light was nice I
wanted to finish the video so I'm going
to go ahead and dust the top a little
bit of cinnamon which is completely
unnecessary
but since I was taking pictures I
decided to go for it okay as usual
garnishing is up to you you are after
all the Franco Sinatra of your Mexican
or ChaCha
and then as you'll notice besides a
glass ice I've also pictured this with a

ordered this that's how it's been
served which I assume is so there's any
sediment gets mixed in evenly but if you
want some people like to let all that
settle and just pour it out of the

sit long enough and strained it properly
it really should make that much of a

and finish this video by telling you
just how refreshing this is and man is
it refreshing okay it's going to be
sweet but not too sweet and then there's
something about that starchiness from
the rice combining with the nuttiness of
the almonds spy simply with that
cinnamon it just makes this an
extraordinarily delicious and refreshing
drink especially during warm weather
although this stuff is so good I would
you're get in the middle of a snowstorm
oh and if you're wondering why I didn't
go with the straw I prefer to just drink
it like this because if there is any
larger pieces of sediment at the bottom
those are going to get sucked up with
every sip so I prefer to enjoy this sand
